channel.title: CyberNetSec - Phishing
channel.description: Latest phishing threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: 700Credit Data Breach Exposes PII of 5.6 Million Individuals
item.description:
The U.S. fintech company 700Credit, a major provider of credit reports and data services to the automotive industry, has disclosed a data breach affecting at least 5.6 million individuals. The incident, which occurred in October 2025, resulted in an unauthorized actor gaining access to and stealing ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hackers Use Animated Lures and Fake Legal Warnings to Spread Malware
item.description:
HP's latest Threat Insights Report reveals a significant evolution in social engineering tactics, with cybercriminals using highly convincing lures such as professional animations and fake legal warnings to trick users into downloading malware. The report highlights a campaign impersonating the Colo...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Intelligence

item.title: "Operation DupeHike" Espionage Campaign Targets Russian Corporate HR Depts
item.description:
A highly targeted cyber-espionage campaign, dubbed "Operation DupeHike," has been identified targeting employees in Russian corporations. Attributed to the threat actor cluster UNG0902, the campaign uses convincing social engineering lures, such as decoy documents about employee bonuses, to infiltra...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Fake Leonardo DiCaprio Movie Torrent Used as Bait to Spread Agent Tesla Trojan
item.description:
Cybercriminals are luring victims with a fake torrent for a new Leonardo DiCaprio movie to distribute the Agent Tesla information-stealing trojan. Security researchers at Bitdefender analyzed the campaign, revealing a complex, multi-stage attack chain that uses a malicious .lnk shortcut, hidden batc...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Vishing Attackers Impersonate IT on Teams, Trick Users into Running Fileless Malware
item.description:
A sophisticated vishing (voice phishing) campaign is abusing trusted enterprise tools to deploy stealthy malware. Attackers impersonate IT support staff on Microsoft Teams, convincing users to initiate a Windows Quick Assist session. Once they have remote access, the attackers direct the user to a m...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: WhatsApp Worm Spreads Astaroth Banking Trojan in New Brazilian Campaign
item.description:
A new malware campaign, tracked as STAC3150, is targeting banking users in Brazil by using WhatsApp Web as a distribution vector for the Astaroth banking trojan. The attack begins with a social engineering lure sent via WhatsApp, which persuades the victim to download a malicious ZIP archive. The ar...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Freedom Mobile Data Breach Exposes Customer PII via Compromised Subcontractor
item.description:
Canadian telecommunications provider Freedom Mobile announced on December 3, 2025, that it suffered a data breach after an unauthorized party gained access to its systems on October 23, 2025. The attacker leveraged the compromised account of a third-party subcontractor to access a customer account m...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: ValleyRAT Malware Targets Job Seekers Using Foxit PDF Reader Disguise
item.description:
A new malware campaign is distributing the ValleyRAT remote access trojan by preying on job seekers. Attackers send emails with weaponized executables disguised as HR documents, using the Foxit PDF Reader icon as a lure. The attack leverages a legitimate, renamed Foxit executable to perform a DLL si...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus APT's Remote IT Worker Infiltration Scheme Exposed in Real-Time
item.description:
A joint investigation by security researchers has exposed the inner workings of a North Korean Lazarus Group scheme where operatives commit identity fraud to get hired as remote IT workers at Western firms. By luring the threat actors into a sophisticated honeypot environment, researchers from BCA L...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Security Operations

item.title: French Football Federation Data Breach Exposes Player Info Via Single Compromised Account
item.description:
The French Football Federation (FFF) announced a significant data breach on November 28, 2025, after an attacker gained access to a centralized administrative software platform using a single compromised user account. The breach exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of a large number...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Phishing
